comment.body: @ulrichard: I believe images have been disabled for privacy reasons.

Am I the only one who see older and unrelated comments to this post?

@ulrichard, did you switch hub, or something?
Perhaps ZeroMe should use UUIDs instead ‚Äì would that be possible (haven't looked at the code)?

@<tkarita/>: Ironically, Erkan registered all those names to prevent squatters from squatting them. Unfortunately Erkan has been absent since May, or so. I may me able to contact him vial plain old email. However, he hasn't responded to zmail, bitmessage or tox messages. I'm unsure if I have his phone number. If I do, I can call him.
Please tell us more. Do you have a blog around here?
Erkan just sent me these few words in a private message on IRC: ¬ªThe outlook for now: I don't run Zeronet anymore.¬´

Today's word of wisdom from Beyond the Known is talking exactly about how you feel:

¬ªIt is not that we have forgotten compassion. We just spend all of our time wishing things were different from what they actually are.¬´
Interesting concept with the public folders. It reminds me of Keybase's public folders.

Which mesh are you talking about?
Theoretically an NTP server on hyperboria/cjdns should be able to broadcast time to fc00::/8's broadcast address. And I assume the same would hold for ZeroTier's ‚ÄúEarth‚Äù mesh.

That's right ‚Äì and it's scary. I found out that Google knows when I start which app, when my phone's screen is blanking (and unblanking). And that's on Cyanogenmod with a minimum (although obviously not minimal enough) of Google installed. üò±
I've always wondered how wifi-location works, do you know?
Ah, ¬ªThe Wi-Fi hotspot database gets filled by correlating mobile device GPS location data with Wi-Fi hotspot MAC addresses.¬´ ‚åò https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wi-Fi_positioning_system
Not quite the same, but there's [ZeroTodos](/1B8LmXYHzMGZzcRWoidAQb5SmKSyfjN63f/).
